mobs.long_desc: A feeble old woman weeps over the wagon.
mobs.desc: She is old, and clearly has suffered some hurt in the recent past. Bruises and scratches mar her skin, and she looks close to tears. For all this, she is almost insubstantial, and in bright light, looks almost transparent. She has intelligent, inquisitive grey eyes, and when she speaks, doesn't sound threatening.

mobs.long_desc: A desperate human bandit skulks in wait for his next victim.
mobs.desc: Standing just over six feet tall, this burly man is built like a skilled warrior. His arms and legs are heavily muscled, and the many scars marking his face show he has been in many battles before. A thick layer of black stubble covers his face, and the stench of stale sweat drifts around him. He is dressed in worn leather armor almost as scarred-up as he is.

mobs.long_desc: A bandit chieftess, magnificently arrayed, skulks here.
mobs.desc: All traces of her previous state are gone, replaced with the hardened expression of a ruthless bandit. With her cloak gone, the worn leather armor below is visible. She commands an air of respect, which is apparent in her combat stance and graceful movement. If someone is foolish enough to underestimate her, they deserve what they get.

mobs.long_desc: A gypsy lord listens to the distant music.
mobs.desc: Bren, lord of the gypsies, is a lithe man, built like a agile hunting cat. His dark black hair and eyes only add to this impression, keeping with the feline-like appearance.  He is dressed in a simple silk tunic and a pair of leather breeches.  He wears soft soled leather boots, which muffle the sound he makes while walking.  Though his physical looks are that of someone with little or no compassion, he is one of the kindest gypsies in the camp.

mobs.long_desc: A lithe gypsy dancer leaps and twirls to the beat of the music.
mobs.desc: &0This young gypsy is about ninteen years old, her figure already much like a grown woman. She is dressed in a loose fitting silk tunic, and layers of colorful skirts, each one a band from the rainbow. She wears a few scarfs around her neck, each one so thin it is nearly transparent. She moves her body to the beat of the music, its subtle movements attracting all the men around her.&0

mobs.long_desc: A gypsy musician plays a guitar, filling the camp with song.
mobs.desc: Armed with only a guitar and giant grin, this young gypsy man seems content with his life and current surroundings.  He plays vigorously on his instrument keeping the music flowing throughout the camp.  Dressed in loose fitting silk clothing, he looks more like a merchant than a gypsy.

mobs.long_desc: A gypsy guards the camp's entrance.
mobs.desc: This middle-aged gypsy stands erect and proud, watching over the entrance to the camp.  Unlike the other gypsies, he seems to block out the joyful music and dancing, instead concentrating fully on his duty.  He stands just under six feet tall and is dressed in leather armor, which drapes itself over his muscular torso.

mobs.long_desc: A gypsy child runs through the camp.
mobs.desc: &0This young lad isn't old enough to play a mandolin yet, nor does he possess the skills needed to guard the camp, so he is allowed to run free, leaping with joy as the music fills the skies. Dirt covers part of his face, left there by the constant falls he takes, when his legs get tangled together. This doesn't seem to hamper his enjoyment however, his laughing voice almost as loud as the music at times.&0

mobs.long_desc: A tired gypsy sleeps on his feather bed.
mobs.desc: Exhaustion has gotten the the upper hand over this poor gypsy, who has partied way too much recently. His hair is unkempt, having been pushed out of place while tossing and turning in his feather bed. Though he is sound asleep a grin covers his face, as the gypsy music seeps into his mind and entangles his dreams.

mobs.long_desc: The gypsy witch sits here in a simple wooden chair.
mobs.desc: She doesn't look like much, the average hunched over, wispy-haired old woman, but her eyes glitter, and her voice is soft but forceful. Gnarled hands move in mysterious ways as she speaks in her quavering manner. She is bundled up like a grandmother, but runes are sewn along the edges of her clothing.

mobs.long_desc: A tower guard watches over the area.
mobs.desc: This tall, muscular guard looks to be in his mid-twenties. Of average appearance for a human, his eyes are particularly watchful, and he himself doesn't seem easily startled. He carries himself with grace and agility.

mobs.long_desc: A cleric of Henya looks for adventure.
mobs.desc: She is very young, with rosy cheeks and bright blue eyes. Her air of total innocence is not marred by her excited wanderings. Blonde hair tumbles in curls down past her shoulders, and she herself doesn't appear very experienced in the world, not being muscled or even wary, as most travelers are.

mobs.long_desc: A southern deer darts through the area.
mobs.desc: Much hardier then their northern cousins, this nimble deer looks to be half starved.  Her ribs can be seen poking out through her skin, and her eyes look pitifully weak.  She sniffs around hungrily, trying to find a bit of grass.

mobs.long_desc: A farmer walks through here.
mobs.desc: &0This sturdy looking man is covered in dirt, probably from doing some type of field work. He is dressed in simple clothing, worn and dirty from years of working the land. Though his life is hard, he makes more then enough to feed his family, which is more then many citizens of Kerristone.&0

mobs.long_desc: A traveling mercenary wanders through the area, looking for work.
mobs.desc: &0This young man must be in his early twenties, though his eyes show the experience of someone twice that age. His face is covered with scars, from both blade and magic. He currently is without a job, wandering the land for some work. &0

mobs.long_desc: A grey hare leaps through the area.
mobs.desc: &0This large grasslande hare is quite large for his species, reaching almost two feet in length, and weighing several pounds.  This is mainly due to the lush plains and mild weather conditions.  For this reason, this hare is hunted frequently for its mean, a favorite among plainsmen and Keep nobles alike.

mobs.long_desc: &0A man renting &3horses&0 stands here.&0
mobs.desc: &0This man is quite large and looks strong enough to look after himself.&0

mobs.long_desc: &0A well trained &3horse&0 stands here.&0
mobs.desc: It looks unfinished.

mobs.long_desc: &0&b&9The Thing &0stands here.&0
mobs.desc: Scary.

mobs.long_desc: A muscular stallion prances here.
mobs.desc: He's big and very strong-looking, with a dark grey coat that darkens to black at his hooves and head. A white star streaks down the center of his face.

mobs.long_desc: &0A stablehand stands here.&0
mobs.desc: It looks unfinished.

objects.ground: An emerald brooch lies here, glinting.

extras.text: This brooch is large, with an inch-long emerald set in a gold cabuchon setting. Its pin is very secure.

The blade of this slender dagger is about a half foot long and razor sharp on both edges.  It looks like it was made of a particularly bright alloy of steel and silver, with not a nick marring its surface.  The hilt is hardwood set with gold chain, its pommel carved into an eagle's head.

objects.ground: A bright, ornate sword lies here.

extras.text: This slender rapier is long, its blade not sharp but is point wickedly so. It is made of some very bright alloy of steel that looks almost silvery, and its hilt is wrapped in blue leather. The crossguard is the traditional basket hilt, but very ornately done, sweeping and scrolling.

objects.ground: &0A talisman lies here, made of wrinkled crow feet.

extras.text: The talisman is a collar of leather, set with wrinkled, desiccated crows' feet. It smells as bad as it looks.

objects.ground: &0A pair of baggy silk breeches lie here.&0

extras.text: These simple silk breeches are made of brilliant scarlet fabric, with gold piping up the legs.  They are very flouncy and puffy, not to mention comfortable.  They close at the waist with gold buttons.

&0This simple scarf is made from a nearly transparent silk.  Streaks of color run along its length, creating a ghostly rainbow.  Its quality is very good, crafted by a master and probably worth a great deal.  &0

objects.ground: A loose, violet silk tunic lies here.

extras.text: Made from a fine silk, this tunic is fit for a noble.  Ivory bottons run down its front, and if it wasn't already used it would be worth a fortune in any clothing store.

objects.ground: A mace with a silver head lies here.

extras.text: The ball of this mace is crafted from silver, and covered with dull knobs, the kind prefered by clerics.  Its shaft is made from a heavy wood, which is wrapped in leather to provide a better grip.

objects.ground: A studded leather tunic lies here.

extras.text: This tunic is made of hard leather, covered in metal armoring studs made of bronze.  It looks utilitarian and thoroughly uncomfortable.

It is a well-balanced weapon with a double-edged blade that is somewhat sharp at the point. A scrolled bronze crossguard protects the hand, and the wooden hilt is wrapped with chain for a good grip. It is not a fancy weapon, but it is effective-looking. An insignia in the pommel identifies the sword as belonging to one of Kerristone's tower guards, to those who would recognize such things.

objects.ground: Someone has left their guitar behind.
objects.action_desc: It is a simply strummed nostalgic tune.

extras.text: This beat-up old guitar isn't in the best shape.  It barely holds a tuning, but with some effort you could probably make it play passably well.

objects.ground: A yummy carrot sits on the ground here, getting dirty.

extras.text: It's that tasty orange vegetable, good for eyesight and bribing horses.

objects.ground: A pile of hay is sitting on the ground.

extras.text: You can't eat it, but horses can.  Yummy.

objects.ground: A cube of while crystalline substance is sitting here.

extras.text: Deeeeelicious!  It would go perfect in coffee.  But how did they get it to stay in a cube?  Magic?

objects.ground: A ripe red strawberry lies here, smelling delicious.

extras.text: This ripe red strawberry has an enticing aroma.

objects.ground: An unfinished object is lying here.

extras.text: The bonfire blazes forth flames of yellow, red, and pale blue. It is well-banked, with a ring of stones around its base.

triggers.name: North_Ker_road_bandit_fight
triggers.commands: * This trigger is the fight trigger that transforms * a poor lil ole lil female merchant into... * The Bandit leader! HA! mecho &0A &b&5feeble merchant&0 tears off her cloak, revealing mecho her true nature as the &b&9bandit leader&0! mteleport %self% 32436 rem brooch give brooch bledq mforce leader hold brooch mteleport leader 32435 mteleport bandit 32435 mteleport bandit 32435 mteleport bandit 32435 mat 32435 mforce leader shout Come on out! We got us some killin to do! mat 32435 mecho &0&b&2The surrounding foilage errupts into movement as&0 mat 32435 mecho &0&b&2three bandits jump out to assist their leader!&0 mat 32435 mforce leader kill %actor.name% mat 32435 mforce bandit kill %actor.name% mat 32435 mforce 2.bandit kill %actor.name% mat 32435 mforce 3.bandit kill %actor.name%

triggers.name: Kerriston_north_horse_look
triggers.commands: wait 1 mecho You can't see anything, the world blurrs around you!

triggers.name: Kerriston_north_horse_timer
triggers.commands: * This is the reception of the carrot * that kicks off the whole affair. if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %object.vnum% == 32421 wait 1 mteleport %actor% 32597 mteleport %self% 32597 mjunk carrot do_it_to_it wait 5 s mecho The world spins by you as you struggle to hang on! wait 5 s mecho The sound of thundering hooves is almost deafening! wait 5 s mecho You slip and nearly fall off! wait 5 s mecho The horse bucks wildly almost throwing you! wait 5 s mecho The tall grass whips by your feet so quickly it stings! wait 5 s mecho Are you slowing down? wait 2 s mteleport %actor% 32461 mteleport %self% 32461 wait 1 mforce %actor% look pant mecho The trained &3horse&0 wiggles from underneath you. wait 1 mpecho The trained &3horse&0 is summoned by his master. mpecho The trained &3horse&0 disappears in a puff of smoke. else wait 1 eye %actor.name% wait 3 bite %actor.name% smile me end else end purge_me

triggers.name: Kerristone_north_trainer_bribeMG
triggers.commands: * This is one of the bribe progs that will * let players buy a horse to bolt to Mugnork * The horse trigs have been altered in concept * on how they deliver the players to the destination * but there's no reason why this trig can't exist * as is to kick it off if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 1 mecho %self.name% says, '&0Ahh Thankyou! You will not be disappointed.&0' mecho %self.name% says, '&0I have one of the fastest &0&b&9stallions&0 in the land for you!' wait 2 mecho &0A &3horse&0 trainer leads a fine looking &b&9stallion&0 into the room. mload mob 32423 wait 2 mecho &0A horse trainer gets under you and pushes you up into the saddle.&0 mload obj 32425 mecho %self.name% says, 'Feed him this &1strawberry&0 and he will know that you want to go to &b&6Mugnork&0.' give strawberry %actor.name% wait 2 mecho &0A &3horse&0 trainer forces your hand towards the mouth of the horse. mforce %actor% give strawberry stallion mecho %self.name% says, 'Good journey!' else end

The horse portion will change * radically from the prog format but will * achieve the same goals. if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 1 mecho %self.name% says, 'Ahh Thankyou! You will not be disappointed.' mecho %self.name% says, 'I have one of the fastest horses in the land for you!' wait 2 mpecho &0The &3horse&0 trainer leads a fine looking horse into the room.&0 mload mob 32421 mecho &0The &3horse&0 trainer gets under you and pushes you up into the saddle.&0 wait 2 mload obj 32421 mecho %self.name% says, '&0Feed him this &0&3carrot&0 and he will know that you want to go to Morgan Hill.&0' give carrot %actor.name% mecho &0The &3horse&0 trainer forces your hand towards the mouth of the &3horse&0. wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'Good journey!' else end

The Lakefolk wat 32598 wecho who have made their home on its shores do not speak of such things, fearing wat 32598 wecho that it will bring bad luck.&0 wait 4 wat 32598 wecho You catch a glimpse of the passing countryside! wat 32598 wecho &3Dirt&0 Road along the Shores of &0&4&bLake Fedis&0 wat 32598 wecho &3   This curving dirt road leads along the shores of Lake Fedis, one of wat 32598 wecho the largest lakes found in the highlands. triggers.name: Kerriston_north_horse_timer2
triggers.commands: * This is the reception of the strawberry * that kicks off the whole affair to Mugnork if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %object.vnum% == 32425 wait 1 mteleport %actor% 32597 mteleport %self% 32597 mjunk strawberry do_it_to_it wait 5 s mecho The world spins by you as you struggle to hang on! wait 5 s mecho The sound of thundering hooves is almost deafening! wait 5 s mecho You slip and nearly fall off! wait 5 s mecho The horse bucks wildly almost throwing you! wait 5 s mecho The tall grass whips by your feet so quickly it stings! wait 5 s mteleport %actor% 32598 mteleport %self% 32598 wait 1 do_it_to_it2 mecho Are you slowing down? wait 5 s mecho A small speckled rabbit runs between the horses legs! SPLAT wait 5 s mecho The world spins by you as you struggle to hang on! wait 5 s mecho You slip and nearly fall off! wait 5 s mecho A Northern Deer darts across the trail infront of you! wait 5 mecho PHEW Nearly teeth, hair, and eyeballs everywhere! wait 3 mteleport %actor% 32565 mteleport %self% 32565 wait 1 mforce %actor% look pant mecho %self.name% wiggles from underneath you. wait 1 mpecho %self.name% is summoned by his master. mpecho %self.name% disappears in a puff of smoke. else wait 1 eye %actor.name% wait 3 bite %actor.name% smile me end else end purge_me

rooms.name: A Dirt Road Through the Grasslands
rooms.description: The road seems to dead-end into a ditch here.  It looks like it once led west, but heavy rains have washed it out to the point where the road is impassible.  Heavy marks of wheels in the mud suggest that a wagon was caught in the heavy rains as well.  The grasslands to the east are open, empty, and serene, appearing to stretch on forever.  The road continues back north, or you could investigate the ditch to the south.

rooms.name: A Dirt Road Through the Grasslands
rooms.description: This simple yet well-maintained road runs in a relatively straight line to the north and south, though many twists and bends add to its character.  Its brown surface cuts a path through the vast grasslands on either side, their endless lengths appearing to stretch on forever.  Though the scenery is serene, the travelers visible on the road appear wary and somewhat suspicious, keeping to themselves.  Occasional patrols from Toldar's Keep can be seen from time to time.  The road runs straight from north to south here.

rooms.name: Steep Ditch in the Road
rooms.description: The ditch here is rather steep, almost vertical, creating a dangerous obstacle for travelers, especially wagons and carts. Almost eight feet high, this dirt slope could easily trap a merchant wagon or kill a horse. It is apparent that this has happened recently, as a set of wagon tracks lead downwards, into the thick foilage below.

rooms.name: Thick Foliage at the Foot of a Slope
rooms.description: The dirt slope leads upwards here, at a sharp angle making travel extremly difficult, especially while mounted. Loose gravel and rocks dot the side, creating dangerous points along its length. Hardy bushes have taken root between these rocks, offering handholds for those trying to climb on foot. The foliage gets thicker around the slopes bottom, but a clearing can be seen just to the south.

rooms.name: Clearing in the Thick Foliage
rooms.description: Thick bushes, most armed with spiny thorns, cover this area in a blanket of green, obscuring most of the slope and blocking any view of the road to the north. Trees, though sparse, dot the area between a few of the bushes, creating a forest-like atmosphere just below the ditch. The wagon trail ends here, right in the middle of a clearing within the foilage. Sitting in the exact center of this clearing is a broken wagon, its wood starting to show the signs of severe weathering. It is hard to determine how long it has been here, but from the overgrowth of trampled bushes, it must have been over three or four days.

rooms.name: A Dirt Road Through the Grasslands
rooms.description: This simple yet well-maintained road runs in a relatively straight line to the north and south, though many twists and bends add to its character.  Its brown surface cuts a path through the vast grasslands on either side, their endless lengths appearing to stretch on forever.  Though the scenery is serene, the travelers visible on the road appear wary and somewhat suspicious, keeping to themselves.  Occasional patrols from Toldar's Keep can be seen from time to time.  The road runs straight from north to south here.

rooms.name: A Dirt Road Through the Grasslands

rooms.name: A Bend in the Road
rooms.description: The northern road cuts through the landscape like a knife, creating a line that leads through flat plains and rolling hills alike.  Made mainly from dirt, it is used by both adventurers and merchants as the ideal route between north and south.

rooms.name: Road Through the Highlands
rooms.description: The northern road cuts through the landscape like a knife, creating a line that leads through flat plains and rolling hills alike.  Made mainly from dirt, it is used by both adventurers and merchants as the ideal route between north and south.

rooms.name: Road Through the Highlands
rooms.description: The northern road cuts through the landscape like a knife, creating a line that leads through flat plains and rolling hills alike.  Made mainly from dirt, it is used by both adventurers and merchants as the ideal route between north and south.

rooms.name: Road Through the Highlands
rooms.description: The northern road cuts through the landscape like a knife, creating a line that leads through flat plains and rolling hills alike.  Made mainly from dirt, it is used by both adventurers and merchants as the ideal route between north and south. A little-used path leads east toward some large stones.

East.description: The path leads up to a small hill with many standing stones.

rooms.name: Road Through the Highlands
rooms.description: The northern road cuts through the landscape like a knife, creating a line that leads through flat plains and rolling hills alike.  Made mainly from dirt, it is used by both adventurers and merchants as the ideal route between north and south.

rooms.name: Road Through the Highlands
rooms.description: The northern road cuts through the landscape like a knife, creating a line that leads through flat plains and rolling hills alike.  Made mainly from dirt, it is used by both adventurers and merchants as the ideal route between Mugnork and Kerristone.

rooms.name: Road Through the Highlands
rooms.description: The northern road cuts through the landscape like a knife, creating a line that leads through flat plains and rolling hills alike.  Made mainly from dirt, it is used by both adventurers and merchants as the ideal route between north and south.

rooms.name: A Collection of Standing Stones
rooms.description: The path ends here, in a clump of trees, with no obvious means of egress except the way you came.  The trees form a thick canopy overhead, giving you some shade.  Among them, an impressive collection of standing stones can be seen.  Each is about eight feet tall, covered from top to bottom with druidic symbols that pulse with unseen power.

rooms.name: Road Through the Highlands
rooms.description: The northern road cuts through the landscape like a knife, creating a line that leads through flat plains and rolling hills alike.  Made mainly from dirt, it is used by both adventurers and merchants as the ideal route between north and south.

rooms.name: Road Through the Highlands
rooms.description: A dirt road cuts through the uneven landscape, over rolling hills and shallow valleys. Though not as well kept as some of the southern roads, it still serves its purpose. Wagon tracks cover most of its surface, both recent and ancient, their existence testimony to the traffic this road has sustained over the many years. The surrounding hills are mostly bare, though some contain small groups of trees or thick underbrush. The occasional glint of water can be seen from one of the many small ponds that are tucked between the steep hillsides. The road runs from east to west.

rooms.name: Road Through the Highlands
rooms.description: A dirt road cuts through the uneven landscape, over rolling hills and shallow valleys. Though not as well kept as some of the southern roads, it still serves its purpose. rooms.name: Road Nearing Lake Fedis
rooms.description: This wide dirt road is rather simple, crafted from packed frozen ground which is just as solid as stone.  Though it can be difficult to travel during the thawing season, it is reliable.  The road cuts through the highlands, creating a path leading from the Wailing Mountains and the far highlands to an unknown destination in the south.  The great body of water known as Lake Fedis can be seen to the north, its surface a crystal blue.  The road runs to the north and south.

rooms.name: Road Nearing Lake Fedis
rooms.description: This wide dirt road is rather simple, crafted from packed frozen ground which is just as solid as stone.  Though it can be difficult to travel during the thawing season, it is reliable.  The road cuts through the highlands, creating a path leading from the Wailing Mountains and the far highlands to an unknown destination in the south.  The great body of water known as Lake Fedis can be seen to the north, its surface a crystal blue.  The road runs to the north and south.

rooms.name: Road Along the Shores of Lake Fedis
rooms.description: This curving dirt road leads along the shores of Lake Fedis, one of the largest lakes found in the highlands . Its icy waters are constantly fed by the WhiteFox river, which is created by melting snow in the Wailing Mountains. The road itself is wide enough to allow two or three merchant wagons to pass at once, though if there should be an accident the sloping ditches could provide a problem. There is little traffic through here, despite the incredible scenery. Trees and shrubs dot the landscape, forming hedgerows and heaths along the lake. The road leaves the lakeside to the south, and extends west for a ways.

rooms.name: Road Along the Shores of Lake Fedis
rooms.description: This curving dirt road leads along the shores of Lake Fedis, one of the largest lakes found in the highlands . There is little traffic through here, despite the incredible scenery. Trees and shrubs dot the landscape, forming hedgerows and heaths along the lake. The road travels east and west along the lake's shores.

rooms.name: Road Along the Shores of Lake Fedis

There is little traffic through here, despite the incredible scenery. Trees and shrubs dot the landscape, forming hedgerows and heaths along the lake.  The road curves north, away from the lake, heading north toward a path cut into the Wailing Mountains.

rooms.name: Road South of the Wailing Mountains
rooms.description: Winds blowing from the Wailing Mountains cut through the area, like shards of ice, ripping away the warmth.  Though very few plants can survive this region, a few stunted trees, mainly conifers, poke up through the snow, providing protection to the wildlife of the area.  The WhiteFox river can be seen running along the eastern side of the road, leading south towards Lake Fedis.  The road leads north and south.

The WhiteFox river can be seen running along the eastern side of the road, leading south towards Lake Fedis.  The road leads north and south.

rooms.name: Road South of the Wailing Mountains
rooms.description: Winds blowing from the Wailing Mountains cut through the area, like shards of ice, ripping away the warmth.  Though very few plants can survive this region, a few stunted trees, mainly conifers, poke up through the snow, providing protection to the wildlife of the area.  The WhiteFox river can be seen running along the eastern side of the road, leading south towards Lake Fedis.  The road leads north and south.

rooms.name: Road South of the Wailing Mountains
rooms.description: The caravan trail through the Wailing Mountains leads off to the east, but to the south is a surprisingly well-maintained road.  Though a rockfall prevents travel north, the road is otherwise very easy to travel on.  Chilling winds sweep down from the Wailing Mountains, but a few pine trees dot the landscape providing shelter from wind and weather for traveller and wildlife alike.  The sound of running water can be heard, but not seen.

rooms.name: A Trail Through the Trees
rooms.description: This simple trail, made from packed dirt, leads across a few rolling hills, towards a small bunch of thick pines. Its course swerves and bends to avoid a few steeper hillocks, and rocks pile at the very base of the trees from the hilltops. The trail itself seems to be well used, though firewood is still available. The trees block all view of the road, and mask the presence of people in them from travelers. The road can be reached from here, if one heads east. The trail extends to the west.

rooms.name: A Trail Through the Trees
rooms.description: This simple trail, made from packed dirt, leads across a few rolling hills, towards a small bunch of thick pines. Its course swerves and bends to avoid a few steeper hillocks, and rocks pile at the very base of the trees from the hilltops. The trail itself seems to be well used, though firewood is still available. The trees block all view of the road, and mask the presence of people in them from travelers. The road can be reached from here, if one heads east. The trail extends to the west.

rooms.name: A Small Copse of Trees
rooms.description: The trail almost completely vanishes as it enters this group of heavily scented pine trees. Roots and thick underbrush cover its surface, until nearly nothing remains. The trees are much thicker when viewed up close, almost like a minature forest within the hills. Though huge tree trunks block line of sight in most directions, they seem to start thinning just to the west. The trail leads off south.

rooms.name: Before a Clearing
rooms.description: The trees start to thin as they reach the bottom of a nearby hill. At the hills base, the path becomes visible once again, freed from the choking underbrush. It leads further westward until it reaches a wide clearing that is surrounded with thick bushes and trees. A bright light can be seen in the center of this clearing, surrounded by several small wooden wagons. Music can be heard drifting up from these wagons, followed closely by the scent of roasting meats.

rooms.name: A Clearing in the Gypsy Camp
rooms.description: Several wagons surround this grassy clearing, forming a semi-circle between the trees and the clearing's center. The wagons are of a simple design, similar to those used by settlers. Each one has a few glass windows to let in light and fresh air when the weather permits. From the look of the old tracks, it appears that these wagons have been here for some time. Though they are mainly known as wanderers, these gypsies have set up a semi-permanent camp, though its purpose is unknown. The entrance to the camp lies eastward.

rooms.name: Inside a Gypsy Wagon
rooms.description: This small cozy wagon is used by a gypsy family as a house, both to store their possessions and to provide shelter from the outside.  It contains a simple feather bed, plush and extremly comfortable, covered with thick quilts which are needed here in the mountains.  A shining brass lamp dangles from a hook in the ceiling, its rocking light creating dancing shadows throughout the wagon.  A stove made from black iron takes up a small section of the far wall. Pots and a kettle cover its surface, and a crackling flame can be heard burning within.  The heat from this stove is more than adequate to heat the small wagon, which only adds to the cozy atmosphere.  Though the interior lacks many decorations, bolts of fine colored silk dangle from the walls and ceiling, creating a rainbow effect the brightens the wooden panels.

rooms.name: Inside a Gypsy Wagon
rooms.description: This small cozy wagon is used by a gypsy family as a house, both to store their possessions and to provide shelter from the outside.  It contains a simple feather bed, plush and extremly comfortable, covered with thick quilts which are needed here in the mountains.  A shining brass lamp dangles from a hook in the ceiling, its rocking light creating dancing shadows throughout the wagon.  A stove made from black iron takes up a small section of the far wall. Pots and a kettle cover its surface, and a crackling flame can be heard burning within.  The heat from this stove is more than adequate to heat the small wagon, which only adds to the cozy atmosphere.  Though the interior lacks many decorations, bolts of fine colored silk dangle from the walls and ceiling, creating a rainbow effect the brightens the wooden panels.

rooms.name: Before a Huge Bonfire
rooms.description: This clearing is carefully constructed to allow for the safe burning of the camp's bonfire. Smoke curls up into the sky, wafting on the winds high above until it is dispersed. Down on the ground, grilles with meat on them rest over the fire here and there, with the sizzling of the food a constant noise. Wooden sticks are plunged into the ground, ready to be taken up and food speared with them. Blankets are laid on the ground here and there around the fire.

rooms.name: In the Clearing
rooms.description: Several wagons surround this grassy clearing, forming a semi-circle between the trees and the clearing's center.  The wagons are of a simple design, similar to those used by settlers.  Each one has a few glass windows to let in light and fresh air when the weather permits.  From the look of the old tracks, it appears that these wagons have been here for some time.  Though they are mainly known as wanderers, these gypsies have set up a semi-permanent camp, though its purpose is unknown.

rooms.name: Inside a Gypsy Wagon
rooms.description: Inside the wagon it is smoky and dimly lit, with candles throwing flames and shadows everywhere. The air smells of tallow candles and old meals of charred meat and vegetables, and is almost hazy by the candlelight. A door leads out to the north.

rooms.name: Inside a Gypsy Wagon
rooms.description: Inside the wagon it is smoky and dimly lit, with candles throwing flames and shadows everywhere. The air smells of tallow candles and old meals of charred meat and vegetables, and is almost hazy by the candlelight. A door leads out to the south.

rooms.name: Inside a Gypsy Wagon
rooms.description: Inside the wagon it is smoky and dimly lit, with candles throwing flames and shadows everywhere. The air smells of tallow candles and old meals of charred meat and vegetables, and is almost hazy by the candlelight. A door leads out to the east.

From the look of the old tracks, it appears that these wagons have been here for some time.  Though they are mainly known as wanderers, these gypsies have set up a semi-permanent camp, though its purpose is unknown.

The wagons are of a simple design, similar to those used by settlers.  Each one has a few glass windows to let in light and fresh air when the weather permits.  From the look of the old tracks, it appears that these wagons have been here for some time.  Though they are mainly known as wanderers, these gypsies have set up a semi-permanent camp, though its purpose is unknown.

rooms.name: Inside the Gypsy Witch's Wagon
rooms.description: Bone white smoke drifts through this wagon, sent off by a collection of incense that lines the room.  Some lie in bowls, burning away, while others are displayed in extravagant golden holders.  The combined scent is nearly overwhelming, resembling both flowers and a dew covered forest.  Throught the smoke a large table can be seen, surrounded with two wooden chairs.  A copper bowl sits in the exact center of the table, contaning a mixture that is far too grotesque to touch.  A set of wide shelves cover most of the eastern wall, each holding a wide assortment of bottles and books.  A bed, covered with simple pillows, takes up part of the southern wall, while a wooden chest sits at the bed's end.

rooms.name: Inside a Gypsy Wagon
rooms.description: Inside the wagon it is smoky and dimly lit, with candles throwing flames and shadows everywhere. The air smells of tallow candles and old meals of charred meat and vegetables, and is almost hazy by the candlelight. A door leads out to the east.

rooms.name: Inside a Gypsy Wagon
rooms.description: Inside the wagon it is smoky and dimly lit, with candles throwing flames and shadows everywhere. The air smells of tallow candles and old meals of charred meat and vegetables, and is almost hazy by the candlelight. A door leads out to the north.

The wagons are of a simple design, similar to those used by settlers.  Each one has a few glass windows to let in light and fresh air when the weather permits.  From the look of the old tracks, it appears that these wagons have been here for some time.  Though they are mainly known as wanderers, these gypsies have set up a semi-permanent camp, though its purpose is unknown.

The wagons are of a simple design, similar to those used by settlers.  Each one has a few glass windows to let in light and fresh air when the weather permits.  From the look of the old tracks, it appears that these wagons have been here for some time.  Though they are mainly known as wanderers, these gypsies have set up a semi-permanent camp, though its purpose is unknown.

rooms.name: Inside a Gypsy Wagon
rooms.description: Inside the wagon it is smoky and dimly lit, with candles throwing flames and shadows everywhere. The air smells of tallow candles and old meals of charred meat and vegetables, and is almost hazy by the candlelight. A door leads out to the south.

rooms.name: Inside a Gypsy Wagon
rooms.description: Inside the wagon it is smoky and dimly lit, with candles throwing flames and shadows everywhere. The air smells of tallow candles and old meals of charred meat and vegetables, and is almost hazy by the candlelight. A door leads out to the west.

rooms.name: Inside the Gypsy Lord's Wagon
rooms.description: This is obviously the wagon of someone very important and influential.  It is nearly twice the size of the other ones found throughout the camp, and filled with a great deal of expensive items.  Ancient tapastries hang from the wooden walls, their brilliant rainbow of colors adding a great deal of life to the drab interior.  Three brass lamps hang from the ceiling, supended in place with cords and hooks.  A massive stove takes up the western wall, used for both cooking and heating the spacious wagon.  The northern wall is dominated by a feather bed, its surface piled with plush pillows and thick blankets.  A table and chair finish of the rest of the furniture, both made from a sturdy dark wood.
